channel.title: Tea With Alice
channel.itunes:subtitle: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:summary: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With a rotating cast of bright and brilliant guests.
channel.description: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With a rotating cast of bright and brilliant guests.

item.title: Airless CarCast - Claire Hooper and Women of Letters
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Running out of Oxygen, but still full of ideas.
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in a car with Claire Hooper in the carpark of Splendour in The Grass. As they slowly run out of oxygen, they talk about anxiety, what's the point of the news, the ethical downsides of being right about anything, Alice's million dollar idea, and how Claire as a new mother feels sorry for Pedophiles.
Appended at the end is Alice's Women of Letters performance, for people who don't mind sad things that aren't funny.
Thanks to Bryce Halliday for the Audio Edit. http://brycehalliday.com Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com Claire is at http://clairehooper.com
item.description:
Alice sits in a car with Claire Hooper in the carpark of Splendour in The Grass. As they slowly run out of oxygen, they talk about anxiety, what's the point of the news, the ethical downsides of being right about anything, Alice's million dollar idea, and how Claire as a new mother feels sorry for Pedophiles.
Appended at the end is Alice's Women of Letters performance, for people who don't mind sad things that aren't funny.
Thanks to Bryce Halliday for the Audio Edit. http://brycehalliday.com Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com Claire is at http://clairehooper.com

item.title: CapperCast Teacast - Nick Capper
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Values and all that
item.itunes:summary:
In a cavernous cafe in Melbourne, Alice sits down with Nick Capper and talks about the value of value, whether we should be careful or not careful with what we say and a lot of other things.
This chat happened chronologically BEFORE last week's chat with Toby Halligan, so some of the ideas here are amoebic forms of what was discussed 'last week'. Ah, time travel.
Hit Alice up on alicerfraser@gmail.com or go to the website alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
In a cavernous cafe in Melbourne, Alice sits down with Nick Capper and talks about the value of value, whether we should be careful or not careful with what we say and a lot of other things.
This chat happened chronologically BEFORE last week's chat with Toby Halligan, so some of the ideas here are amoebic forms of what was discussed 'last week'. Ah, time travel.
Hit Alice up on alicerfraser@gmail.com or go to the website alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: OffenseCast Teacast - Toby Halligan
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Political is Personal vs Generalities of Identity Politics
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks in a fancy boulangerie slash teahouse in Melbourne with Toby Halligan during his lunchbreak. Toby is a writer for The Project, creater and facilitator of political comedy all over Australia and just a generally interesting and cool guy. They discuss giant sandwiches, scurrilous comedy scene gossip, identity politics and what's the best way to take offense.
Toby is online at www.tobyhalligan.com.au and Alice is available (as ever) on http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:

item.title: In An Invisible BoxCast - Trygve Wakenshaw
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking to the movement
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in her favourite Tea Shop and talks to Fred Winner and Barry Award Nominee Trygve Wakenshaw about being an apprentice vegan, what it's like being like nobody else, Status, Prizes, Astrology and Death.
Trygve can be found at http://trygvewakenshaw.net
Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com or @aliterative
Note the much better sound quality? YEAH! Editing by the excellent Bryce Halliday (http://brycehalliday.com)

item.title: CakeCast Teacast - Laura Davis
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Morality of Cake
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks with comedian and writer Laura Davis about the Morality of Cake, different kinds of strength, child abuse, why peer pressure works, and why good people let bad things happen to them.
item.description: Alice talks with comedian and writer Laura Davis about the Morality of Cake, different kinds of strength, child abuse, why peer pressure works, and why good people let bad things happen to them.

item.title: Aspirational Punchingcast - Adam Yardley Returns
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Return of the Dad-Cast
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks in Glebe's WellCo cafe with Adam Yardley. They eat eggs on toast and drink chalky green tea and talk about reading playboy for the articles, Alice's recent almost viral article, walking into traffic, islamophobia and provocateurism.
item.description: Alice talks in Glebe's WellCo cafe with Adam Yardley. They eat eggs on toast and drink chalky green tea and talk about reading playboy for the articles, Alice's recent almost viral article, walking into traffic, islamophobia and provocateurism.

item.title: Stay At Home DadCast - Adam Yardley
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Manliness and Confidence
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks with friend and comedy writer Adam Yardley over some awesome sencha about manliness, being a stay at home dad, time travel and performance enhancing drugs for corporate women.
item.description: Alice talks with friend and comedy writer Adam Yardley over some awesome sencha about manliness, being a stay at home dad, time travel and performance enhancing drugs for corporate women.

item.title: The Luce-Cast - Lucy Howard Taylor
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Birds and The Boys
item.itunes:summary: Alice Fraser talks to Lucy Howard Taylor and some incidental rainbow lorrikeets over a quick lunch in the Rocks. Lucy is a writer, poet and arts administrator in the Sydney Theatre Company and they chat about Rap, the fraught nature of having opinions, authenticity and how Zombies are like teenage boys.
item.description: Alice Fraser talks to Lucy Howard Taylor and some incidental rainbow lorrikeets over a quick lunch in the Rocks. Lucy is a writer, poet and arts administrator in the Sydney Theatre Company and they chat about Rap, the fraught nature of having opinions, authenticity and how Zombies are like teenage boys.

item.title: Nothing Susscast - Tami Sussman
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Parallel Lifecast
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser talks to weirdly similar and yet excitingly different middle-name-sharing Tami Sussman performance poet, wedding celebrant and standup comedian. They have probably jasmine green tea and chat about The Salmon Lady, what's wrong with people who seem too normal, why the vibrator is a lie and the amazing thing about vests. With brief cameo from Henry Fraser.
Tami can be found on twitter at @sussmania Alice is all at http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:

With brief cameo from Henry Fraser.
Tami can be found on twitter at @sussmania Alice is all at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: A Musical Ramblecast - Tom Wrigglesworth
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Ballbearing murders and a rolling good time.
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks to British Comedian, Radio Personality and all round excellent eccentric, Tom Wrigglesworth. The ramble through music, a jew called Adolf, pain-pissing contests and redlining on anxiety. Producer Bryce Halliday http://brycehalliday.com/
item.description: Alice talks to British Comedian, Radio Personality and all round excellent eccentric, Tom Wrigglesworth. The ramble through music, a jew called Adolf, pain-pissing contests and redlining on anxiety. Producer Bryce Halliday http://brycehalliday.com/

item.title: Returning Brycecast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Some hissing but good chat
item.itunes:summary: Alice sits with Bryce Halliday and has a conversation in a bed of snakes on a waterfall with someone snowboarding behind them. Apologies for the background snowscape. They talk impro and vocation, travel and possibility.
item.description: Alice sits with Bryce Halliday and has a conversation in a bed of snakes on a waterfall with someone snowboarding behind them. Apologies for the background snowscape. They talk impro and vocation, travel and possibility.

item.title: The Rodcast - Mr Makim Scoops the Ukraine
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Cracking the Ironed Curtain
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks over tea and a rusty nail with Roderick Makim, journalist, country boy and international thrillseeker in a nice coat about his roots, being a Western Spy, and the disappointments of chicken Kiev.
item.description: Alice talks over tea and a rusty nail with Roderick Makim, journalist, country boy and international thrillseeker in a nice coat about his roots, being a Western Spy, and the disappointments of chicken Kiev.

item.title: Chip Flavourcast - With Rob Hunter
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Alice Hunts down some Information, then sets it free.
item.itunes:summary: Alice gets to know Rob Hunter over tea and conversations about chip flavours, first jobs, and where we're really from.
item.description: Alice gets to know Rob Hunter over tea and conversations about chip flavours, first jobs, and where we're really from.

item.title: Right in The FaithCast - Andrew Judd
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Religious chat in a lift-well
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks to the Reverend Andrew Judd about faith, failure and his man-crush on Jarrod McKenna. Henry Fraser shows up to ask some cheeky questions. This was recorded on a phone in a lift well, so credit goes to Bryce Halliday for Production skills.
item.description: Alice talks to the Reverend Andrew Judd about faith, failure and his man-crush on Jarrod McKenna. Henry Fraser shows up to ask some cheeky questions. This was recorded on a phone in a lift well, so credit goes to Bryce Halliday for Production skills.

item.title: BasementCast Teacast - Bryce Halliday
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sliding Downhill
item.itunes:summary: Alice Fraser teas and talks with Bryce Halliday deep underground. They chat about comedy festival, whether women should be stay-at-home-mums and why Alice ate all the snacks.
item.description: Alice Fraser teas and talks with Bryce Halliday deep underground. They chat about comedy festival, whether women should be stay-at-home-mums and why Alice ate all the snacks.

item.title: Godcast Teacast with Jarrod McKenna
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Conversation in a cafe about god and comedy
item.itunes:summary: Alice and Jarrod McKenna talk about Christlikeness, Faith, Narnia, Comedy, Zizek, Ursula LeGuin, Wil Anderson and the Refugee Crisis.
item.description: Alice and Jarrod McKenna talk about Christlikeness, Faith, Narnia, Comedy, Zizek, Ursula LeGuin, Wil Anderson and the Refugee Crisis.

item.title: Overcast Teacast - Melbourne Dreaming
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sean and Alice talk about bigotry and Festival Marketing
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk about Bigotry and Festival Marketing. Warning - heavier on comedy discussion than usual.
(note: Slightly quiet volume wise. So listen somewhere chilled out.) 1min - The Danger of Energy Drinks 3mins - Panic Naps and Chronic Stress 10mins - The Exciting Bigotry of Hecklers 13mins - Creating a Brand 28mins - Tindr Marketing 29.50mins - Love induced erectile dysfunction 33mins - Getting really good at forgetting everything 35.50 - The Zombie Apocalypse 42.10 - Disability and Intellectual Snobbery 44.40 - Is it worth being happy for an hour 47.20 - Madness and Sadness, the Conversation takes a sad turn.
SHOW DETAILS Sean Michaels "I Wasn't Sean Yesterday" - Tuxedo Cat #MICF Alice Fraser "Everyone's A Winner" - Swanston Hotel, 8.30pm
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Tea's A Crowd or a Fourcast Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Adam Yardley, Fiona Yardley and Richard Parkin and A Baby and A Plane
item.itunes:summary:
Alice has tea and talks in a remarkably civilised fourway throwdown about violence and criminality. Chapter titles if you want to skip ahead or back are as follows:
4.50 minutes in – Punching for no reason. 9.05 mins – Gendered dreams [do babies dream of electric babies?]. 13.20 – Aggression as a problem solving tool, violent fantasies and masculine heroism. 17 mins – The righteous smashing! 20 mins – A heavily visual joke… 21 mins - Swimming in salt water; complicated grief. 24 mins – The transcendental beauty of the imperfect... 26 mins – Criminality and Criminology. 30 mins – No-one wants to be an arsehole? 33 mins - Passive Aggression is not that bad.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative
item.description:
Alice has tea and talks in a remarkably civilised fourway throwdown about violence and criminality. Chapter titles if you want to skip ahead or back are as follows:
4.50 minutes in – Punching for no reason. 9.05 mins – Gendered dreams [do babies dream of electric babies?]. 13.20 – Aggression as a problem solving tool, violent fantasies and masculine heroism. 17 mins – The righteous smashing! 20 mins – A heavily visual joke… 21 mins - Swimming in salt water; complicated grief. 24 mins – The transcendental beauty of the imperfect... 26 mins – Criminality and Criminology. 30 mins – No-one wants to be an arsehole? 33 mins - Passive Aggression is not that bad.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Quali-Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sweet mics and hot conversation
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice take tea and talk no regrets, secular churches, the idea of friends with benefits, left handed people, relationship evolution, theme parks and some other stuff.
Sean's back and the original teacast two slide a sweet sounding show smoothly into your ear holes.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com or subscribe on itunes

http://alicecomedyfraser.com or subscribe on itunes

item.title: Trapped in an Industrial Fancast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sean Returns
item.itunes:summary: Despite the ominous 'womm wommm' noise, this tea was delightful and lighthearted. Sean and Alice have tea and talk about how having a broken headlight is like being cheated on, how Sean secretly doesn't want to sleep with every girl he dates. We discuss babushka dolls, when you want to be making risky decisions and how to be the master(bater) of your own destiny.
item.description: Despite the ominous 'womm wommm' noise, this tea was delightful and lighthearted. Sean and Alice have tea and talk about how having a broken headlight is like being cheated on, how Sean secretly doesn't want to sleep with every girl he dates. We discuss babushka dolls, when you want to be making risky decisions and how to be the master(bater) of your own destiny.

item.title: Tea with Greg Fleetcast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Bookshop Junkies
item.itunes:summary:
Alice and Greg Fleet have tea in a bookshop cafe. They talk flirting, punching Hitler, sympathy for pedophiles, anger management and how to destroy a friendship.
Look out for Greg Fleet at a comedy festival near you. Tickets available online.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative
item.description:
Alice and Greg Fleet have tea in a bookshop cafe. They talk flirting, punching Hitler, sympathy for pedophiles, anger management and how to destroy a friendship.
Look out for Greg Fleet at a comedy festival near you. Tickets available online.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: A Modest Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Swift and psychology, tea to the Max
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk over tea about how love is an addiction, bad investments, getting out while you're on top, and then play out an upsetting rant on a (non) alternative to the refugee crisis.
If you like the podcast, rate and review it on itunes, or recommend it to your friends. Visit Alice at - http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative
item.description:
Sean and Alice talk over tea about how love is an addiction, bad investments, getting out while you're on top, and then play out an upsetting rant on a (non) alternative to the refugee crisis.
If you like the podcast, rate and review it on itunes, or recommend it to your friends. Visit Alice at - http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Love Me Tindercast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Taking a swipe at modern love
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice have tea and talk about compliments, modern love, disco-ball surgery and the worst kind of profiling.
Alice loves the idea of marriage, but wants to propose an alternative for people that are less certain about the 'as long as we both shall live' part.
subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it.
Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com
http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Twincast Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Double Trouble with the Fraser Twins
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks to her twin brother in a cafe in Oxford about criticism, self-doubt and the self indulgence of kickstarter.
Sean's offline again this week, so sound quality is Alice-style, and we're rocking a slightly late release.
see Henry's music at http://henryfraser.com subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it. Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com

item.title: Half-cast teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Twice the Tea, None of the Sean
item.itunes:summary:
All alone in England, Alice pulls a conversation out of the archives for the first Guest Teacast. With Scott Huntington, talking about men's rights activists, and deja-poo.
Find Scott's music online at http://listn.to/socalledfriend Alice is online at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Teacast all the way to the Bank
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Catfished by a Corporation
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk about how corporations aren't people too, how it's not good to get too close to your money, and how to avoid a spiral of liking that ends in marriage.
(slightly shorter than usual, as Alice is in England and cut out a thing and couldn't figure out how to replace it with another thing)
alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Teacast Art Imitating Lifecast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Third Time Lucky
item.itunes:summary: Sean tells a joke that you will never hear, Alice rants about whether art is or is not a luxury and the urge to create or play video games. They reflect on corporate life.
item.description: Sean tells a joke that you will never hear, Alice rants about whether art is or is not a luxury and the urge to create or play video games. They reflect on corporate life.

item.title: Teacast predator vs alienation
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's be Positive (about consent)
item.itunes:summary: Strap yourselves in. Alice educates Sean about dubious consent, they talk about smoke and mirrors, the jazz hands part of sex and what happens when a bird flies into the window.
item.description: Strap yourselves in. Alice educates Sean about dubious consent, they talk about smoke and mirrors, the jazz hands part of sex and what happens when a bird flies into the window.

item.title: Post Christmas Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Birth of the Gripes Child
item.itunes:summary: Alice has tea with Sean. They talk about pride, love and loss, and school. Alice rants about goodwill to all mankind, and Sean talks about breakups with a friend.
item.description: Alice has tea with Sean. They talk about pride, love and loss, and school. Alice rants about goodwill to all mankind, and Sean talks about breakups with a friend.
